#summary Some additional information on Joe-E.

= Introduction to Joe-E =

We have written a [http://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~daw/papers/joe-e-ndss10.pdf scientific paper] with a detailed overview of Joe-E and its design.
Also, our [http://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~daw/joe-e/nsf-poster.pdf poster]
provides a brief overview to Joe-E.

Also, you can find a list of our [Publications scientific publications] on Joe-E.

= Joe-E Language Specification =

The [http://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~daw/joe-e/spec-20090918.pdf latest draft of the language spec] is from September 18, 2009.

= Introduction to Object Capabilities =

Joe-E is an object-capability system.  Want some background on object-capability systems?  A short [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Object-capability_model overview of the object-capability model] is available on Wikipedia.  Don't miss Ben Laurie's [http://www.links.org/files/capabilities.pdf introduction to capabilities] and how they provide a useful approach to access control. For another overview of some work on object-capability systems, you can watch [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=EGX2I31OhBE a survey talk] by David Wagner, or read [http://www.cs.berkeley.edu/~daw/talks/TRUST07.pdf his annotated slides].  The [http://www.eros-os.org/mailman/listinfo/cap-talk cap-talk mailing list] is a good place to discuss the object-capability model, and the 
[http://www.eros-os.org/mailman/listinfo/e-lang e-lang mailing list] is a good place to discuss language-based approaches to object-capabilities (such as Joe-E).

= Historical Information =

Older versions of the specifications, code, and other info of solely
